Erik Wilde (@dret): Let's Fix HAL!

(2) Summary

The Hypertext Application Language (HAL) has gained some popularity, but it also is held back by design issues that make the language ill-defined. This is a call to action to fix HAL and get it to the point where it is well-defined and its definition can enter an open and broad review and standardization process.

(8) Some Examples 

{ "_links": {
    "curies": [ { "name": "prefix1", "href": "http://example.com/rel/{rel}" },
                { "name": "prefix2", "href": "http://example.com/rel/{rel}" } ],
    "prefix1:link": { "href": "/example1" },
    "prefix2:link": { "href": "/example2" } }}
  • duplicate-prefix.json
{ "_links": {
    "curies": [ { "name": "prefix", "href": "http://example.com/rel/{rel}" } ]},
  "_embedded": { "_links": { "prefix:link": { "href": "/example" } }}}
  • curie-scope.json
{ "_links": {
    "curies": [ { "name": "prefix", "href": "http://example.com/rel/{rel}" } ],
    "prefix:link": { "href": "/example" } },
  "_embedded": { "item" : {
    "_links": {
      "curies": [ { "name": "prefix", "href": "http://example.org/rel/{rel}" } ], 
      "prefix:link": { "href": "/example" } }}}}
  • prefix-override.json
{ "_embedded": { "item" : [
  { "_links": {
      "curies": [ { "name": "prefix", "href": "http://example.com/rel/{rel}" } ], 
      "prefix:link": { "href": "/example" } }},
  { "_links": {
      "curies": [ { "name": "prefix", "href": "http://example.org/rel/{rel}" } ], 
      "prefix:link": { "href": "/example" } }}]}}
  • prefix-confusion.json


5 in 5: Let's Fix HAL! Erik Wilde (@dret): Let's Fix HAL!

(9) If it's broken, fix it

  • HAL needs a bit of housekeeping
    • A HAL CURIE is not a CURIE
    • Embedded resources are underspecified
    • Namespace (CURIE) mechanics are underspecified
  • Community consensus on deployed code and design fixes
    • (Some) breakage is unavoidable when fixing broken specifications
    • Make the transition clear (it won't be clean)
    • Provide test suites/tools to help with the transition
  • Restart with a new media type or be explicit about legacy issues


5 in 5: Let's Fix HAL! Erik Wilde (@dret): Let's Fix HAL!

(10) The Case of GeoJSON

  • Successful community standard with many adopters
    • Specification issues caused interoperability problems
    • Specification status caused adoption issues
  • IETF GeoJSON WG [https://datatracker.ietf.org/wg/geojson/] with the intentionally narrow goal of fixing it
    • Resist the temptation to add features
    • Fix known problems and produce a widely recognized specification
  • RFC 8142 [https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8142] was published after about a year of work


5 in 5: Let's Fix HAL! Erik Wilde (@dret): Let's Fix HAL!

(11) HAL Call to Action

  • Is it worth the effort to "fix HAL"?
  • If it is, what would be the best way forward?
